alert.note: Alert for Crockett; Kimble; Mason; Menard; San Saba; Schleicher; Sutton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 29 at 2:58PM CST until February 01 at 9:00AM CST by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Significant icing possible from freezing rain and sleet. The Northwest Hill Country and Edwards Plateau south of a San Angelo to Brady line may stay above freezing and avoid the impacts from the first round of wintry precipitation tonight and Monday morning. However, as temperatures continue to fall, these areas are likely to see freezing rain and sleet sleet develop Monday Night and continue into Wednesday across this area and the rest of West Central Texas. * WHERE...All of west central Texas * WHEN...From Monday afternoon through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Accumulations of ice on roadways may make for hazardous travel conditions. Accumulations are also possible on power lines and trees.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Crockett; Kimble; Mason; Menard; San Saba; Schleicher; Sutton
